head.supplied: ¶ If it gives not too much trouble to order an additional supply of the lithographic paper for the Eucalyptus-Atlas, I shall be quite glad if the remaining sum is expended for the purpose, as this pu...

div.p: 81/R48385, unit 915, VPRS 1207/P000 inward registered correspondence, VA 865 Department of the Treasurer, Public Record Office, Victoria.

If it gives not too much trouble to order an additional supply of the lithographic paper for the Eucalyptus-Atlas, I shall be quite glad if the remaining sum is expended for the purpose, as this publication is yet far from completion.
On 26 January 1881, E. Symonds, Under Treasurer, wrote to Odgers, Under Secretary, advising that a balance of £17.18.3 for paper for the Eucalyptus Atlas was in the hands of the Agent General and asking if it was still required. The letter was forwarded to M on 29 January 1881 asking if the balance was required. In accordance with M's request, a further supply of plate paper was ordered on 16 February 1881. However, on 19 May 1881, the Agent General's office wrote to say that the supplier could not supply less than 25 reams of the paper, and that the sum available was insufficient for this; see T. Wilson to M, 2 August 1881 (in this edition as 81-08-02a), and M to T. Wilson, 6 August 1881 (in this edition as 81-08-06a).
At the time of this letter the seventh decade of Eucalyptographia had been issued; see B80.13.14. The final part was B84.11.02.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
